projects.shortDescription: I developed this game for a hackathon I participated in. The goal was to progress through the doors at each level of a castle, either encountering a monster or reaching the treasure.
longDescription: Embark on an exciting adventure in our innovative game designed to challenge players through four main components: Doors, Levels, Castles, and Treasures. Each level features a series of closed doors, behind which lie various hidden objects. As players navigate through multiple levels within each castle, they face the thrill of discovery and the potential for peril.

The objective is simple: click on the doors to reveal their contents. Players may uncover a passage to the next level or encounter a monster that ends their game. Successfully finding a pass allows players to advance through each door, leading them closer to the treasures waiting at the end of every castle. Along the way, players earn points for progressing through levels, with additional lives and bonuses hidden behind the doors for those daring enough to explore.

projects.shortDescription: EMS is an app designed for viewers of a TV game show to answer questions and win prizes using their mobile devices. The primary goal was to enhance viewer engagement with the show.
longDescription: This application was designed for a game show hosted on a television channel. The main idea behind the app was to engage viewers and encourage interaction with the show.

The format of the game show was similar to "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire" where the host asked a series of questions to the contestant, and they could win money by answering correctly. Meanwhile, viewers could also play the game on their mobile devices, allowing them to feel as if they were part of the TV show.

They could answer the same questions as those on TV and earn reward points for their participation, which they could later redeem. There was also a feature allowing players to view their rankings and see how their points compared to those of other players.

projects.shortDescription: I was a Part of the team which designed the Jira-servicenow app connector which could push the data from customer's Jira cloud instance to Servicenow instance
longDescription: This app is designed for seamless integration in the cloud. This app empowers users to effortlessly push data from Jira Cloud to their ServiceNow instance as updates are made.

Users have complete control over the data transfer process, enabling them to specify exactly which Jira data gets sent to ServiceNow and in which fields that data is placed. The app offers custom configurations, allowing for precise field mappings between Jira and ServiceNow, ensuring that data is organized exactly as needed.

This connector not only facilitates the data transfer but also handles any necessary transformations required during the process. This ensures a smooth and efficient integration experience, enhancing productivity and streamlining workflows between these two powerful platforms.

workItems.dotTooltipText: II was working as a contract employee for this organization and implemented the integration for OpenCart using the third party integration apis. I was also involved in suggesting improvements in their process, tech-stack and implementations.

I was Hired as a tech lead over here and my main responsibility was to guide the team technically on the project and to mentor junior developers. There were many project which I used to work on simultaneously. I was also involved in calls for collecting client requirements and to propose over all architectures for implementation, guide the implementation aiding wherever required and giving the clients demos and updates.
I was hired as a senior software engineer over here Role: Support a CMS developed in Wordpress which was supposed to go to production in a months time.
I was Hired as a Associate tech lead over here and my main responsibility was to guide the team technically on the project and to mentor junior developers.

Initially I worked over here as a Software Engineer but later was promoted to Senior software engineer. Here are mostly worked with the US clients where I was the only technical person working from India and coordinating with tech lead and manager from US.
I worked as a developer in a team of 10 members. reporting to a technical manager who was onsite in US. I worked on a couple of projects during my time here.
Earned the Oracle certified Java Professional 1.6 certification
Completed Java, J2EE, spring and Hibernate courses from the institute

I was responsible for managing the computer networks of the organization, as well as maintaining the software on our systems. Our infrastructure included an MS Exchange on-premises server, a Windows server, and a mix of Windows and Linux machines. A key achievement in this role was installing Linux machines and successfully integrating them with the Windows server. This allowed users to access the ERP systems hosted on the Windows server with different user accounts, thereby saving the organization from purchasing additional Windows licenses.
